display_name.description: The name of the alerting profile, displayed in the UI.

mz_id.description: The ID of the management zone to which the alerting profile applies.

case_insensitive.description: The condition is case sensitive (false) or case insensitive (true). If not set, then false is used, making the condition case sensitive.

enabled.description: The filter is enabled (true) or disabled (false).

negate.description: Reverses the comparison operator. For example it turns the begins with into does not begin with.

operator.description: Operator of the comparison. You can reverse it by setting negate to true.

block.description: Configuration of a matching filter.

case_insensitive.description: The condition is case sensitive (false) or case insensitive (true). If not set, then false is used, making the condition case sensitive.

enabled.description: The filter is enabled (true) or disabled (false).

negate.description: Reverses the comparison operator. For example it turns the begins with into does not begin with.

operator.description: Operator of the comparison. You can reverse it by setting negate to true.

block.description: Configuration of a matching filter.
Configuration of a custom event filter.

event_type.description: The type of the predefined event.

negate.description: The alert triggers when the problem of specified severity arises while the specified event is happening (false) or while the specified event is not happening (true).

block.description: Configuration of a predefined event filter.
Configuration of the event filter for the alerting profile.

delay_in_minutes.description: Send a notification if a problem remains open longer than X minutes.

severity_level.description: The severity level to trigger the alert.

context.description: The origin of the tag, such as AWS or Cloud Foundry. Custom tags use the CONTEXTLESS value.

key.description: The key of the tag. Custom tags have the tag value here.

value.description: The value of the tag. Not applicable to custom tags.

block.description: A tag-based filter of monitored entities.
Configuration of the tag filtering of the alerting profile.

A list of severity rules. The rules are evaluated from top to bottom. The first matching rule applies and further evaluation stops. If you specify both severity rule and event filter, the AND logic applies.

creation_date.description: Token creation date in ISO 8601 format (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS'Z')

enabled.description: The token is enabled (true) or disabled (false).

expiration_date.description: The expiration date of the token.

last_used_date.description: Token last used date in ISO 8601 format (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS'Z')

name.description: The name of the token.

personal_access_token.description: The token is a personal access token (true) or an API token (false).

scopes.description: A list of the scopes to be assigned to the token.

application_identifier.description: The Dynatrace entity ID of the application, for example APPLICATION-4A3B43.

name.description: The unique name of the Application detection rule.

order.description: The order of the rule in the rules list.

application_match_target.description: Where to look for the the pattern value.

block.description: The condition of an application detection rule.

name.description: The name of the auto-tag, which is applied to entities. Additionally you can specify a valueFormat in the tag rule. In that case the tag is used in the name:valueFormat format. For example you can extend the Infrastructure tag to Infrastructure:Windows and Infrastructure:Linux.

enabled.description: Tag rule is enabled (true) or disabled (false).

propagation_types.description: How to apply the tag to underlying entities.

type.description: Type of entities to which the rule applies.

value_format.description: The value of the auto-tag. If specified, the tag is used in the name:valueFormat format.

case_sensitive.description: Defines if value to compare to is case sensitive

negate.description: Reverses the comparison operator. For example it turns the begins with into does not begin with.

operator.description: Operator of the comparison. You can reverse it by setting negate to true. Possible values depend on the type of the comparison. Find the list of actual models in the description of the type field and check the description of the model you need.

type.description: Defines the actual set of fields depending on the value.

block.description: Defines how the matching is actually performed: what and how are we comparing.

attribute.description: The attribute to be used for comparision.

dynamic_key.description: Dynamic key generated based on selected type/attribute.

type.description: Defines the actual set of fields depending on the value.

block.description: The key to identify the data we're matching.
A list of matching rules for the management zone. The management zone applies only if all conditions are fulfilled.
The list of rules for tag usage. When there are multiple rules, the OR logic applies.

groups.description: List of user's user group IDs.

password_clear_text.description: User's password in a clear text; used only to set initial password

has_manage_account_and_view_product_usag.description: If true, then the group has the manage account rights.

is_cluster_admin_group.description: If true, then the group has the cluster administrator rights.

name.description: Group name

sso_group_names.description: SSO group names. If defined it's used to map SSO group name to Dynatrace group name, otherwise mapping is done by group name

name.description: The name of the dashboard.

shared.description: The dashboard is shared (true) or private (false).

tags.description: A set of tags assigned to the dashboard.

valid_filter_keys.description: A set of all possible global dashboard filters that can be applied to dashboard

timeframe.description: The default timeframe of the dashboard.

id.description: The ID of the Dynatrace entity.

name.description: The name of the Dynatrace entity.

block.description: The short representation of a Dynatrace entity.
Filters, applied to a dashboard.

link_shared.description: If true, the dashboard is shared via link and authenticated users with the link can view.

published.description: If true, the dashboard is published to anyone on this environment.

block.description: Sharing configuration of a dashboard.
Parameters of a dashboard.

assigned_entities.description: The list of Dynatrace entities, assigned to the tile.

chart_visible.description: The tile is visible and ready to use (true) or just placed on the dashboard (false).

configured.description: The tile is configured and ready to use (true) or just placed on the dashboard (false).

custom_name.description: The name of the tile, set by user.

exclude_maintenance_windows.description: Include (`false') or exclude (`true`) maintenance windows from availability calculations.

limit.description: The limit of the results, if not set will use the default value of the system.

markdown.description: The markdown-formatted content of the tile.

metric.description: The tile is visible and ready to use (true) or just placed on the dashboard (false).

name.description: The name of the tile.

query.description: A [user session query](https://www.dynatrace.com/support/help/shortlink/usql-info) executed by the tile.

tile_type.description: Defines the actual set of fields depending on the value.

timeframe_shift.description: The comparison timeframe of the query. If specified, you additionally get the results of the same query with the specified time shift.

height.description: The height of the tile, in pixels.

left.description: The horizontal distance from the top left corner of the dashboard to the top left corner of the tile, in pixels.

top.description: The vertical distance from the top left corner of the dashboard to the top left corner of the tile, in pixels.

width.description: The width of the tile, in pixels.

block.description: The position and size of a tile.

custom_name.description: The name of the tile, set by user.

default_name.description: The default name of the tile.

filters_per_entity_type.description: A list of filters, applied to specific entity types.

left_axis_custom_unit.description: The custom unit for the left Y-axis.

legend_shown.description: Defines if a legend should be shown.

right_axis_custom_unit.description: The custom unit for the right Y-axis.

aggregation.description: The charted aggregation of the metric.

entity_type.description: The type of the Dynatrace entity that delivered the charted metric.

metric.description: The name of the charted metric.

type.description: The visualization of the timeseries chart.

entity_dimension.description: The name of the entity dimension by which the metric is split.

id.description: The ID of the dimension by which the metric is split.

name.description: The name of the dimension by which the metric is split.

block.description: Configuration of the charted metric splitting.

Configuration of the custom filter of a tile.

timeframe.description: The default timeframe of the tile.

id.description: The ID of the Dynatrace entity.

name.description: The name of the Dynatrace entity.

A filter applied to a tile, it overrides the dashboard's filter.

has_axis_bucketing.description: The axis bucketing when enabled groups similar series in the same virtual axis.

create_token.description: If true, a token management token with the scopes 'apiTokens.read' and 'apiTokens.write' and 'TenantTokenManagement'is created when creating a new environment.

name.description: The display name of the environment.

state.description: Indicates whether the environment is enabled or disabled. The default value is ENABLED.

tags.description: A set of tags that are assigned to this environment. Every tag can have a maximum length of 100 characters.

trial.description: Specifies whether the environment is a trial environment or a non-trial environment. Creating a trial environment is only possible if your license allows that.

max_limit.description: Concurrent environment quota. Not set if unlimited. When updating via PUT method, skipping this field will set quota unlimited.

block.description: Custom metrics consumption and quota information on environment level. Not set (and not editable) if Custom metrics is not enabled. Not set (and not editable) if Davis data units is enabled. If skipped when editing via PUT method then already set quota will remain.

annual_limit.description: Annual environment quota. Not set if unlimited. When updating via PUT method, skipping this field will set quota unlimited.

consumed_this_month.description: Monthly environment consumption. Resets each calendar month.

consumed_this_year.description: Yearly environment consumption. Resets each year on license creation date anniversary.

monthly_limit.description: Monthly environment quota. Not set if unlimited. When updating via PUT method, skipping this field will set quota unlimited.

block.description: Davis data units consumption and quota information on environment level. Not set (and not editable) if Davis data units is not enabled. If skipped when editing via PUT method then already set quotas will remain.

annual_limit.description: Annual environment quota. Not set if unlimited. When updating via PUT method, skipping this field will set quota unlimited.

consumed_this_month.description: Monthly environment consumption. Resets each calendar month.

consumed_this_year.description: Yearly environment consumption. Resets each year on license creation date anniversary.

monthly_limit.description: Monthly environment quota. Not set if unlimited. When updating via PUT method, skipping this field will set quota unlimited.

block.description: DEM units consumption and quota information on environment level. Not set (and not editable) if DEM units is not enabled. If skipped when editing via PUT method then already set quotas will remain.

max_limit.description: Concurrent environment quota. Not set if unlimited. When updating via PUT method, skipping this field will set quota unlimited.

block.description: Host units consumption and quota information on environment level. If skipped when editing via PUT method then already set quota will remain.

annual_limit.description: Annual environment quota. Not set if unlimited. When updating via PUT method, skipping this field will set quota unlimited.

consumed_this_month.description: Monthly environment consumption. Resets each calendar month.

consumed_this_year.description: Yearly environment consumption. Resets each year on license creation date anniversary.

monthly_limit.description: Monthly environment quota. Not set if unlimited. When updating via PUT method, skipping this field will set quota unlimited.

block.description: Log monitoring consumption and quota information on environment level. Not set (and not editable) if Log monitoring is not enabled. Not set (and not editable) if Log monitoring is migrated to Davis data on license level. If skipped when editing via PUT method then already set quotas will remain.

consumed_this_month.description: Monthly environment consumption. Resets each calendar month.

consumed_this_year.description: Yearly environment consumption. Resets each year on license creation date anniversary.

block.description: User session properties consumption information on environment level.

annual_limit.description: Annual environment quota. Not set if unlimited. When updating via PUT method, skipping this field will set quota unlimited.

consumed_this_month.description: Monthly environment consumption. Resets each calendar month.

consumed_this_year.description: Yearly environment consumption. Resets each year on license creation date anniversary.

monthly_limit.description: Monthly environment quota. Not set if unlimited. When updating via PUT method, skipping this field will set quota unlimited.

block.description: Synthetic monitors consumption and quota information on environment level. Not set (and not editable) if neither Synthetic nor DEM units is enabled. If skipped when editing via PUT method then already set quotas will remain.

consumed_mobile_sessions_this_year.description: Yearly Mobile user sessions environment consumption. Resets each year on license creation date anniversary.

consumed_nobile_sessions_this_month.description: Monthly Mobile user sessions environment consumption. Resets each calendar month.

consumed_user_sessions_with_mobile_sessi.description: Monthly Mobile user sessions with replay environment consumption. Resets each calendar month.
Yearly Mobile user sessions with replay environment consumption. Resets each year on license creation date anniversary.

consumed_user_sessions_with_web_session_.description: Monthly Web user sessions with replay environment consumption. Resets each calendar month.
Yearly Web user sessions with replay environment consumption. Resets each year on license creation date anniversary.

total_annual_limit.description: Yearly Web user sessions with replay environment consumption. Resets each year on license creation date anniversary.

total_consumed_this_month.description: Monthly total User sessions environment consumption. Resets each calendar month.

total_consumed_this_year.description: Yearly total User sessions environment consumption. Resets each year on license creation date anniversary.

total_monthly_limit.description: Monthly total User sessions environment quota. Not set if unlimited. When updating via PUT method, skipping this field will set quota unlimited.

block.description: User sessions consumption and quota information on environment level. If skipped when editing via PUT method then already set quotas will remain.

Environment level consumption and quotas information. Only returned if includeConsumptionInfo or includeUncachedConsumptionInfo param is true. If skipped when editing via PUT method then already set quotas will remain.
Session replay retention settings on environment level. Can be set to any value from 1 to 35 days. If skipped when editing via PUT method then already set limit will remain.

Log monitoring storage usage and limit information on environment level. Not editable when Log monitoring is not allowed by license or not configured on cluster level. If skipped when editing via PUT method then already set limit will remain.
Real user monitoring retention settings on environment level. Can be set to any value from 1 to 35 days. If skipped when editing via PUT method then already set limit will remain.

Service code level retention settings on environment level. Service code level retention time can't be greater than service request level retention time and both can't exceed one year.If skipped when editing via PUT method then already set limit will remain.

Service request level retention settings on environment level. Service code level retention time can't be greater than service request level retention time and both can't exceed one year.If skipped when editing via PUT method then already set limit will remain.
Session replay retention settings on environment level. Can be set to any value from 1 to 35 days. If skipped when editing via PUT method then already set limit will remain.

retention_reduction_percentage.description: Percentage of truncation for new data.

block.description: Session replay storage usage and limit information on environment level. If skipped when editing via PUT method then already set limit will remain.
Symbol files from mobile apps storage usage and limit information on environment level. If skipped when editing via PUT method then already set limit will remain.
Synthetic monitoring retention settings on environment level. Can be set to any value from 1 to 35 days. If skipped when editing via PUT method then already set limit will remain.

retention_reduction_percentage.description: Percentage of truncation for new data.

block.description: Transaction storage usage and limit information on environment level. If skipped when editing via PUT method then already set limit will remain.

Maximum number of newly monitored entry point PurePaths captured per process/minute on environment level. Can be set to any value from 100 to 100000. If skipped when editing via PUT method then already set limit will remain.

Maximum number of user actions generated per minute on environment level. Can be set to any value from 1 to 2147483646 or left unlimited. If skipped when editing via PUT method then already set limit will remain.
Environment level storage usage and limit information. Not returned if includeStorageInfo param is not true. If skipped when editing via PUT method then already set limits will remain.

description.description: A short description of the maintenance purpose.

name.description: The name of the maintenance window, displayed in the UI.

suppression.description: The type of suppression of alerting and problem detection during the maintenance.

type.description: The type of the maintenance: planned or unplanned.

end.description: The end date and time of the maintenance window validity period in yyyy-mm-dd HH:mm format.

recurrence_type.description: The type of the schedule recurrence.

start.description: The start date and time of the maintenance window validity period in yyyy-mm-dd HH:mm format.

zone_id.description: The time zone of the start and end time. Default time zone is UTC.

day_of_month.description: The day of the month for monthly maintenance.

day_of_week.description: The day of the week for weekly maintenance.

duration_minutes.description: The duration of the maintenance window in minutes.

start_time.description: The start time of the maintenance window in HH:mm format.

block.description: The recurrence of the maintenance window.
The schedule of the maintenance window.

entities.description: A list of Dynatrace entities (for example, hosts or services) to be included in the scope.

mz_id.description: The ID of a management zone to which the matched entities must belong.

tag_combination.description: The logic that applies when several tags are specified: AND/OR.

type.description: The type of the Dynatrace entities (for example, hosts or services) you want to pick up by matching.

context.description: The origin of the tag, such as AWS or Cloud Foundry.

block.description: The tag you want to use for matching.
A matching rule for Dynatrace entities.
The scope of the maintenance window.

name.description: The name of the management zone.

enabled.description: The rule is enabled (true) or disabled (false).

key.description: The reference value for comparison. For conditions of the DIMENSION type, specify the key here.

value.description: The value of the dimension. Only applicable when the conditionType is set to DIMENSION.

block.description: A list of conditions for the management zone. The management zone applies only if all conditions are fulfilled.
A list of dimensional data rules for management zone usage. If several rules are specified, the OR logic applies.

enabled.description: The rule is enabled (true) or disabled (false).

propagation_types.description: How to apply the management zone to underlying entities.

type.description: The type of Dynatrace entities the management zone can be applied to.

case_sensitive.description: Defines if value to compare to is case sensitive

negate.description: Reverses the comparison operator. For example it turns the begins with into does not begin with.

operator.description: Operator of the comparison. You can reverse it by setting negate to true. Possible values depend on the type of the comparison. Find the list of actual models in the description of the type field and check the description of the model you need.

attribute.description: The attribute to be used for comparision.

A list of rules for management zone usage. Each rule is evaluated independently of all other rules.

accept_any_certificate.description: Accept any, including self-signed and invalid, SSL certificate (true) or only trusted (false) certificates.

account.description: The name of the PagerDuty account.

active.description: The configuration is enabled (true) or disabled (false).

alerting_profile.description: The ID of the associated alerting profile.

api_key.description: The API key of the target account.

application_key.description: The application key for the Trello account.

authorization_token.description: The application token for the Trello account.

bcc_receivers.description: The list of the email BCC-recipients

board_id.description: The Trello board to which the card should be assigned.

body.description: The template of the email notification.

cc_receivers.description: The list of the email CC-recipients

channel.description: The channel (for example, `#general`) or the user (for example, `@john.smith`) to send the message to.

custom_message.description: The custom message of the notification.

domain.description: The region domain of the OpsGenie.

instance_name.description: The ServiceNow instance identifier. It refers to the first part of your own ServiceNow URL.

issue_type.description: The type of the Jira issue to be created by this notification.

job_template_id.description: The ID of the target Ansible Tower job template.

job_template_url.description: The URL of the target Ansible Tower job template.

list_id.description: The Trello list to which the card should be assigned.

name.description: The name of the notification configuration.

notify_event_merges_enabled.description: Call webhook if new events merge into existing problems.

payload.description: The content of the notification message.

project_key.description: The project key of the Jira issue to be created by this notification.

receivers.description: The list of the email recipients.

resolved_list_id.description: The Trello list to which the card of the resolved problem should be assigned.

routing_key.description: The routing key, defining the group to be notified.

service_api_key.description: The API key to access PagerDuty.

subject.description: The subject of the email notification.

summary.description: The summary of the Jira issue to be created by this notification.

text.description: The text of the generated Trello card.

url.description: The URL of the notification endpoint.

name.description: The name of the HTTP header.

value.description: The value of the HTTP header. May contain an empty value.

block.description: A list of the additional HTTP headers.

type.description: The type of the web application.

url_injection_pattern.description: Url injection pattern for manual web application.

name.description: The name of the conversion goal.

type.description: The type of the conversion goal.

url_or_path.description: The path to be reached to hit the conversion goal.

block.description: Configuration of a destination-based conversion goal.

match_entity.description: The type of the entity to which the rule applies.

num_user_actions.description: The number of user actions to hit the conversion goal.

frustrating_fallback_threshold.description: Fallback threshold of an XHR action, defining a tolerable user experience, when the configured KPM is not available.

frustrating_threshold.description: Maximal value of apdex, which is considered as tolerable user experience.

threshold.description: Maximal value of apdex, which is considered as satisfied user experience.

tolerated_fallback_threshold.description: Fallback threshold of an XHR action, defining a satisfied user experience, when the configured KPM is not available.

tolerated_threshold.description: Maximal value of apdex, which is considered as satisfied user experience.

frustrating_threshold.description: Maximal value of apdex, which is considered as tolerable user experience.

threshold.description: Maximal value of apdex, which is considered as satisfied user experience.

capturing_name.description: The name of the meta data to capture.

name.description: Name for displaying the captured values in Dynatrace.

public_metadata.description: True if this metadata should be captured regardless of the privacy settings.

type.description: The type of the meta data to capture.

unique_id.description: The unique id of the meta data to capture.

block.description: Java script agent meta data capture settings.

add_cross_origin_anonymous_attribute.description: Add the cross origin = anonymous attribute to capture JavaScript error messages and W3C resource timings.

cache_control_header_optimizations.description: Optimize the value of cache control headers for use with Dynatrace real user monitoring enabled/disabled.

correlation_header_inclusion_regex.description: To enable RUM for XHR calls to AWS Lambda, define a regular expression matching these calls, Dynatrace can then automatically add a custom header (x-dtc) to each such request to the respective endpoints in AWS. Important: These endpoints must accept the x-dtc header, or the requests will fail.

custom_configuration_properties.description: Additional JavaScript tag properties that are specific to your application. To do this, type key=value pairs separated using a (|) symbol.

exclude_xhr_regex.description: You can exclude some actions from becoming XHR actions. Put a regular expression, matching all the required URLs, here. If noting specified the feature is disabled.

library_file_location.description: The location of your application’s custom JavaScript library file. If nothing specified the root directory of your web server is used. Only supported by auto-injected applications.

monitoring_data_path.description: The location to send monitoring data from the JavaScript tag. Specify either a relative or an absolute URL. If you use an absolute URL, data will be sent using CORS.

script_tag_cache_duration_in_hours.description: Time duration for the cache settings.

secure_cookie_attribute.description: Secure attribute usage for Dynatrace cookies enabled/disabled.

server_request_path_id.description: Path to identify the server’s request ID.

instrument_unsupported_ajax_frameworks.description: Instrumentation of unsupported Ajax frameworks enabled/disabled.

max_action_name_length.description: Maximum character length for action names. Valid values range from 5 to 10000.

max_errors_to_capture.description: Maximum number of errors to be captured per page. Valid values range from 0 to 50.

special_characters_to_escape.description: Additional special characters that are to be escaped using non-alphanumeric characters in HTML escape format.

sync_beacon_firefox.description: Send the beacon signal as a synchronous XMLHttpRequest using Firefox enabled/disabled.

sync_beacon_internet_explorer.description: Send the beacon signal as a synchronous XMLHttpRequest using Internet Explorer enabled/disabled.

max_dom_nodes_to_instrument.description: Max. number of DOM nodes to instrument. Valid values range from 0 to 100000.

user_mouseup_event_for_clicks.description: Use mouseup event for clicks enabled/disabled.

block.description: Additional event handlers and wrappers.
In addition to the event handlers, events called using addEventListener or attachEvent can be captured. Be careful with this option! Event wrappers can conflict with the JavaScript code on a web pag.

additional_event_captured_as_user_input.description: Additional events to be captured globally as user input. For example, DragStart or DragEnd.

block.description: Global event capture settings.
Advanced JavaScript tag settings.

mode.description: The mode of the list of browser restrictions.

browser_type.description: The type of the browser that is used.

browser_version.description: The version of the browser that is used.

platform.description: The platform on which the browser is being used.

block.description: A list of browser restrictions.
Settings for restricting certain browser type, version, platform and, comparator. It also restricts the mode.

visually_complete_and_speed_index.description: Visually complete and Speed index support enabled/disabled.

non_w3c_resource_timings.description: Timing for JavaScript files and images on non-W3C supported browsers enabled/disabled.

non_w3c_resource_timings_instrumentation.description: Instrumentation delay for monitoring resource and image resource impact in browsers that don't offer W3C resource timings. Valid values range from 0 to 9999. Only effective if nonW3cResourceTimings is enabled

resource_timing_capture_type.description: Defines how detailed resource timings are captured.

resource_timings_domain_limit.description: Limits the number of domains for which W3C resource timings are captured. Only effective if resourceTimingCaptureType is CAPTURE_LIMITED_SUMMARIES.

w3c_resource_timings.description: W3C resource timings for third party/CDN enabled/disabled.

block.description: Settings for resource timings capture.

temporary_action_limit.description: Defines how deep temporary actions may cascade. 0 disables temporary actions completely. Recommended value if enabled is 3.

temporary_action_total_timeout.description: The total timeout of all cascaded timeouts that should still be able to create a temporary action.

timed_action_support.description: Timed action support enabled/disabled. Enable to detect actions that trigger sending of XHRs via setTimout methods.

block.description: Settings for timed action capture.

image_url_blacklist.description: A RegularExpression used to exclude images and iframes from being detected by the VC module.

inactivity_timeout.description: The time in ms the VC module waits for no mutations happening on the page after the load action. Defaults to 1000.

mutation_blacklist.description: Query selector for mutation nodes to ignore in VC and SI calculation.

mutation_timeout.description: Determines the time in ms VC waits after an action closes to start calculation. Defaults to 50.

threshold.description: Minimum visible area in pixels of elements to be counted towards VC and SI. Defaults to 50.

block.description: Settings for VisuallyComplete2
Settings for content capture.

mode.description: The mode of the list of ip address restrictions.

address.description: The IP address to be mapped.

address_to.description: The to address of the IP address range.

subnet_mask.description: The subnet mask of the IP address range.

block.description: The IP address or the IP address range to be mapped to the location.
Settings for restricting certain ip addresses and for introducing subnet mask. It also restricts the mode.
Support of various JavaScript frameworks.

enabled.description: The enable or disable rule of the java script injection.

html_pattern.description: The html pattern of the java script injection.

rule.description: The url rule of the java script injection.

url_operator.description: The url operator of the java script injection.

url_pattern.description: The url pattern of the java script injection.

block.description: Rules for javascript injection.
Real user monitoring settings.

cost_control_percentage.description: Session replay sampling rating in percentage.

enabled.description: You can exclude some actions from becoming XHR actions. Put a regular expression, matching all the required URLs, here. If noting specified the feature is disabled.

block.description: Session replay settings

aggregation.description: The aggregation type of the property.

cleanup_rule.description: The cleanup rule of the property.

display_name.description: The display name of the property.

ignore_case.description: If true, the value of this property will always be stored in lower case. Defaults to false.

metadata_id.description: If the origin is META_DATA, metaData id of the property.

server_side_request_attribute.description: The ID of the request attribute.

store_as_session_property.description: If true, the property is stored as a session property.

store_as_user_action_property.description: If true, the property is stored as a user action property.

type.description: The data type of the property.

unique_id.description: The ID of the request attribute.

block.description: Defines userAction and session custom defined properties settings of an application.

split_user_actions_by_domain.description: Deactivate this setting if different domains should not result in separate user actions.

use_first_detected_load_action.description: First load action found under an XHR action should be used when true. Else the deepest one under the xhr action is used.

template.description: Naming pattern. Use Curly brackets {} to select placeholders.

operand1.description: Must be a defined placeholder wrapped in curly braces.

operand2.description: Must be null if operator is "IS_EMPTY", a regex if operator is "MATCHES_REGULAR_ERPRESSION". In all other cases the value can be a freetext or a placeholder wrapped in curly braces.

block.description: Defines the conditions when the naming rule should apply.
User action naming rules for custom actions.

template.description: Naming pattern. Use Curly brackets {} to select placeholders.

operand1.description: Must be a defined placeholder wrapped in curly braces.

operand2.description: Must be null if operator is "IS_EMPTY", a regex if operator is "MATCHES_REGULAR_ERPRESSION". In all other cases the value can be a freetext or a placeholder wrapped in curly braces.

block.description: Defines the conditions when the naming rule should apply.
User action naming rules for loading actions

name.description: Placeholder name.

use_guessed_element_identifier.description: Use the element identifier that was selected by Dynatrace.

fallback_to_input.description: If set to true: Returns the input if patternBefore or patternAfter cannot be found and the type is SUBSTRING. Returns the input if regularExpression doesn't match and type is EXTRACT_BY_REGULAR_EXPRESSION. Otherwise null is returned.

pattern_after.description: The pattern after the required value. It will be removed.

pattern_before.description: The pattern before the required value. It will be removed.

pattern_to_replace.description: The pattern to be replaced. Only applicable if the type is REPLACE_WITH_PATTERN.

regular_expression.description: A regular expression for the string to be extracted or replaced. Only applicable if the type is EXTRACT_BY_REGULAR_EXPRESSION or REPLACE_WITH_REGULAR_EXPRESSION.

type.description: An action to be taken by the processing.

block.description: Processing actions
User action placeholders

template.description: Naming pattern. Use Curly brackets {} to select placeholders.

operand1.description: Must be a defined placeholder wrapped in curly braces.

operand2.description: Must be null if operator is "IS_EMPTY", a regex if operator is "MATCHES_REGULAR_ERPRESSION". In all other cases the value can be a freetext or a placeholder wrapped in curly braces.

block.description: Defines the conditions when the naming rule should apply.
User action naming rules for xhr actions.
Defines userAction and session custom defined properties settings of an application.

cleanup_rule.description: Cleanup rule expression of the userTag

ignore_case.description: If true, the value of this tag will always be stored in lower case. Defaults to false.

metadata_id.description: If it's of type metaData, metaData id of the userTag.

unique_id.description: UniqueId, unique among all userTags and properties of this application.

block.description: User Tags settings.

resources_browser_caching_threshold.description: Warn about resources with a lower browser cache rate above X%.

resources_threshold.description: Warn about resources larger than X bytes.

slow_cdn_resources_threshold.description: Warn about slow CDN resources with a response time above X ms.

slow_first_party_resources_threshold.description: Warn about slow 1st party resources with a response time above X ms.

slow_third_party_resources_threshold.description: Warn about slow 3rd party resources with a response time above X ms.

speed_index_visually_complete_ratio_thre.description: Warn if Speed index exceeds X % of Visually complete.

uncompressed_resources_threshold.description: Warn about uncompressed resources larger than X bytes.

block.description: These settings influence the monitoring data you receive for 3rd party, CDN, and 1st party resources.

frustrating_fallback_threshold.description: Fallback threshold of an XHR action, defining a tolerable user experience, when the configured KPM is not available.

frustrating_threshold.description: Maximal value of apdex, which is considered as tolerable user experience.

threshold.description: Maximal value of apdex, which is considered as satisfied user experience.

tolerated_fallback_threshold.description: Fallback threshold of an XHR action, defining a satisfied user experience, when the configured KPM is not available.

tolerated_threshold.description: Maximal value of apdex, which is considered as satisfied user experience.

block.description: Defines the Apdex settings of an application.

display_name.description: The name of the Dynatrace entity.

id.description: The ID of the Dynatrace entity.
